{{Infobox military person |image= |name= Tony Fraser |birth_place= [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]] |death_place= ||caption= |nickname= Tony |allegiance= {{flagicon|Australia}} [[Australia]] |serviceyears= 1977 – Present |rank= [[Major General (Australia)|Major General]] |branch= [[Australian Army]] |commands= [[Australian 16th Brigade|16th Brigade (Aviation)]]
[[5th Aviation Regiment (Australia)|5th Aviation Regiment]]
[[171st Aviation Squadron (Australia)|171st Aviation Squadron]] |unit= |battles= |awards= [[Officer of the Order of Australia]]
[[Conspicuous Service Cross]] |laterwork= }} [[Major General (Australia)|Major General]] '''Anthony Peter Fraser''' [[Order of Australia|AO]], [[Conspicuous Service Cross|CSC]] (b. November 1958) is a senior member of the [[Australian Army]]. He is currently Head, Helicopter Systems Division within the [[Defence Materiel Organisation]]. Tony Fraser was born in [[Sydney]] in November 1958, and grew up in regional [[New South Wales]]. He joined the [[Australian Army]] in July 1977 as an Aviation Cadet and graduated from the Officer Cadet School Portsea in June 1978. In 1987-88 he served in [[Israel]] and [[Lebanon]] with the [[United Nations]] Truce Supervisory Organisation (UNTSO), following which he was awarded a Chief of the General Staff (CGS) Commendation. In 1992 he was awarded the Conspicuous Service Cross.[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=914268&search_type=advanced&showInd=true It's an Honour] - Conspicuous Service Cross - 08 June 1992 Upon promotion to [[Colonel]] in January 2000 he assumed the appointment of Commander 1st Division Aviation, a tenure that included command of the Sydney Olympics Joint Aviation Group.[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=1042278&search_type=simple&showInd=true It's an Honour] - Member of the Order of Australia - 26 January 2003
Citation: ''For exceptional service to the Australian Army as Commanding Officer 5th Aviation Regiment and as Commander Divisional Aviation.'' He was promoted to [[Brigadier]] in January, 2003, and to [[Major General]] on 25 August 2006. Major General Fraser has 5400 flying hours, mostly on helicopters, and he has achieved an A1 instructor category. He was appointed an [[Officer of the Order of Australia]] in the 2010 [[Australia Day]] Honours List.{{cite web|url=http://www.gg.gov.au/res/File/PDFs/honours/ad10/Media%20Notes%20AO(Mil)%20(final).pdf|title=Officer (AO) in the Military Division of the Order of Australia|accessdate=26 January 2010|format=PDF|work=Australia Day 2010 Honours List|publisher=The Australian Honours Secretariat}} Tony Fraser is married to Kelly and they have two young daughters. ==References and notes== *[http://www.defence.gov.au/leaders/fraser.htm ADF Biography] {{reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Fraser, Tony | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1958 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fraser, Tony}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Australian generals]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Officers of the Order of Australia]] [[Category:Recipients of the Conspicuous Service Cross (Australia)]]
